brief_summary.textblock:
The role of vitamin D deficiency in female reproduction remains controversial. Early
      retrospective studies were inconsistent regarding the effect of serum 25-OH vitamin D levels
      on pregnancy rates in women undergoing in vitro fertilization (IVF), whereas two
      retrospective studies postulated that vitamin D deficiency may negatively affect pregnancy
      rates with an effect mediated through the endometrium.

      Taking into account that knock-out experiments have shown that vitamin D receptor null mice
      not only experience uterine hypoplasia but also impaired folliculogenesis, it might be
      hypothesized that vitamin D deficiency may have a detrimental effect on female ovarian
      reserve. This may be further supported by previous reports demonstrating that serum 25-OH
      Vitamin D levels correlates with antimullerian hormone (AMH) levels in women of advanced
      reproductive age.

      The aim of this study is to examine through a large set of prospectively recruited infertile
      women whether serum 25-OH-Vitamin D levels is related with the 2 most widely accepted
      biomarkers of ovarian reserve: serum AMH levels and antral follicle count (AFC).

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D Deficiency and Ovarian Reserve Among Infertile Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Infertile women

          -  1 year of infertility

          -  Age 18-43

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

study_pop.textblock: Infertile women 18-43 years old undergoing IVF/ICSI

facility.name: Centre for Reproductive Medicine UZ Brussel

clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D Deficiency and Ovarian Reserve Among Infertile Patients. A Cross-sectional Analysis

primary_outcome.description: On the day of the preliminary testing (irrespective of the day of the menstrual cycle) patients will have their serum 25-OH-vitamin D and antimullerian hormone levels determined. 25-OH-vitamin D and antimullerian hormone levels will be measured in samples retrieved on the same day
primary_outcome.measure: Antimullerian hormone values in relation to vitamin D status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between 0-28 days prior to having their 1st ultrasound scan for the determination of antral follicle count (AFC)

primary_outcome.description: On the following cycle of the measurement of serum 25-OH-Vitamin D and AMH levels patient will have a transvaginal ultrasound to determine the antral follicle count (AFC)
primary_outcome.measure: Antral follicle count in relation to vitamin D status
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd-3rd day of the menstrual cycle following the determination of vitamin D levels
